Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0684 b) Date of Occurrence: 22/01/2024
c) Installation Details: Wasp Interceptor - AC-9466-510 at
Sector South Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 28/01/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Turbine Assembly d) Main Assembly: Station-3 Port
e) Nomenclature: Turbine Assembly Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: PR-1721-K6 h) Sl No.: SN-1497-342
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 11/10/2022 l) Date of Removal: 25/01/2024
Pg No: 54 Ln No: 2 Pg No: 55 Ln No: 24
m) Manufacturing Agency: Alpha Aviation Corp n) Date, Month & Year December 2020
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3791 Hrs / 619 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Turbine Assembly component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Replace defective component with serviceable unit from approved stock
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate.
Date: 23/02/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 24/02/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 27/02/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 01/03/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 29/02/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
